Description:
Defines how multimedia audio can be streamed from one device to another over a Bluetooth connection (it is also called Bluetooth Audio Streaming).
temi Robot can be used as both A2DP master/source and A2DP slave/sink.

This profile is designed to provide a standard interface to control TVs, Hi-fi equipment, etc. to allow a single remote control (or other device) to control all of the A/V equipment to which a user has access. It may be used in concert with A2DP or VDP.
This allows devices to send text, e-mails, vCards, or other items to printers based on print jobs.
Provides profile discovery and description services for Bluetooth Low Energy protocol. It defines how ATT attributes are grouped together into sets to form services.
Provides the basis for A2DP and VDP, the basis of the systems designed for distributing video and audio streams using Bluetooth technology.
This profile is used to allow car hands-free kits to communicate with mobile phones in the car.
Profile designed to facilitate transmission and reception of Medical Device data.
This is the most commonly used profile, providing support for the popular Bluetooth headsets to be used with mobile phones and gaming consoles.
Provides support for devices such as mice, joysticks, keyboards, and simple buttons and indicators on other types of devices.
Message Access Profile specification allows exchange of messages between devices. Mostly used for automotive handsfree use.
A profile for sending "objects" such as pictures, virtual business cards, or appointment details.
This profile is intended to allow the use of Bluetooth Network Encapsulation Protocol on Layer 3 protocols for transport over a Bluetooth link.
A profile that allows exchange of Phone Book Objects between devices.
This profile emulates serial cables to provide a simple substitute for existing RS-232, including the familiar control signals.
